ca.uqac.lif.cep.gnuplot

Class GnuplotHeatMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.uqac.lif.cep.Processor
      • ca.uqac.lif.cep.SingleProcessor
        • ca.uqac.lif.cep.gnuplot.GnuplotProcessor
          • ca.uqac.lif.cep.gnuplot.GnuplotHeatMap

  • public class GnuplotHeatMap
extends GnuplotProcessor
    Generates a Gnuplot file from a 2D EmlBag. The keys of the heatmap are NamedTuples of integers representing (x,y) coordinates; the values of the heatmap are integers. When its method GnuplotProcessor.compute(Object[]) is called, the processor returns a String containing a Gnuplot file producing the graphical heatmap from the last map received as an input.

    Dimensions of the map must first be declared through setDimensions(int, int, int, int). It shall be noted that the map passed to the processor does not need to define a value for every (x,y) coordinate in the declared space; missing points are given the value zero.

    Optionally, a title for the output graph can be defined using GnuplotProcessor.setTitle(String).

    Author:
    sylvain

      • setDimensions

        public void setDimensions(int x1,
                 int y1,
                 int x2,
                 int y2)
        Sets the coordinate space for the heat map. The map will be drawn in the rectangle (x1, y1) - (x2, y2).
        Parameters:
        x1 - x coordinate of the rectangle
        y1 - y coordinate of the rectangle
        x2 - x coordinate of the rectangle
        y2 - y coordinate of the rectangle
